attributes.action: Put pressure on the World Community to strive and pressurise for the rights of Christians in North Korea
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
100,000 Christians are held in North Korea as political prisoners.

All those deemed to have any relations with South Korea are killed in secret

A former prison guard "They investigated whether the repatriated people had any relationship with South Korea. If a person met South Koreans or reporters or wrote articles, or attended church or escaped after committing a crime in North Korea, they would be secretly killed, without even God knowing."

Yet the British government does little to support christians in North Korea or to put pressure both on North Korea or the international community to put pressure on the government
